Prehistory is the time before we had books. It started when the first humans appeared, about 300,000 years ago. It ended when people began writing things down, around 5,000 years ago. 'Prehistory' refers to the period before written records, spanning from the Big Bang to the invention of writing, approximately 13.8 billion years ago to around 3000 BCE. It's divided into four eras: Hadean, Archaean, Proterozoic, and Phanerozoic, each marked by significant geological and biological changes. Humans emerged in the late Pleistocene epoch of the Phanerozoic era, around 300,000 years ago.

It spans from the emergence of Homo sapiens around 300,000 years ago to the invention of writing systems around 3,200 BCE. This time is also known as the Stone Age, because people used stones for tools. They hunted, gathered food, and lived in small groups. Prehistory ended when people started to write, and we can read about their lives.
